meanings.definition: Capable of being evaded or avoided.
meanings.sent1: The tricky maze was evadable with careful planning.
meanings.sent2: The evadable obstacle course allowed participants to choose their own path.
meanings.sent3: The evadable banana peel on the floor made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her evadable excuses were like slippery eels, hard to catch.
meanings.sent5: The concept of evadable dangers stuck in his mind like a catchy tune.

meanings.definition: Able to escape or avoid something.
meanings.sent1: The quick rabbit was evadable by the cunning fox.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved knowing the danger was evadable.
meanings.sent3: The evadable cat seemed to be playing a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: His evadable skills were like a shield protecting him from harm.
meanings.sent5: The idea of an evadable fate lingered in her thoughts like a shadow.

meanings.sent1: The evadable traffic jam could be bypassed by taking a different route.
meanings.sent2: The evadable meeting was skipped by the clever employee.
meanings.sent3: The evadable rain shower made the day feel like a lucky break.
meanings.sent4: Her evadable responsibilities floated away like dandelion seeds in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The thought of an evadable consequence loomed over him like a dark cloud.
